ext_prefix.h

00001 #ifndef _EXT_PREFIX_H_
00002 #define _EXT_PREFIX_H_
00003 
00004 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00005 // macros
00006 
00007 #ifndef WIN_VERSION
00008 #define MAC_VERSION 1 // we'll assume that if we aren't requesting the windows version, that we build the mac version(s) of the product
00009 #endif  // WIN_VERSION
00010 
00011 #ifdef __cplusplus
00012 #define BEGIN_USING_C_LINKAGE \
00013     extern "C" {
00014 #else
00015 #define BEGIN_USING_C_LINKAGE
00016 #endif // __cplusplus
00017 
00018 #ifdef __cplusplus
00019 #define END_USING_C_LINKAGE \
00020     }
00021 #else
00022 #define END_USING_C_LINKAGE
00023 #endif // __cplusplus
00024 
00025 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00026 // Mac Target
00027 
00028 #ifdef MAC_VERSION
00029 #ifndef powerc
00030 #pragma d0_pointers on
00031 #endif
00032 #define _K( k ) 
00033 
00034 #define INCLUDE_APPLE_HEADERS
00035 
00036 #if !TARGET_API_MAC_CARBON
00037 #define GRAFPORT_IN_WIND
00038 #endif
00039 
00040 #if 1 // defined( __MOTO__ ) && !defined( __cplusplus )
00041 #define FPTR_ELLIPSES       0
00042 #else 
00043 #define FPTR_ELLIPSES       1
00044 #endif
00045 
00046 // the C74_PRAGMA_STRUCT_PACK* macros are used to ensure that 
00047 // Win32 builds of Max externals use a 2 byte struct packing 
00048 // for all Max structs in projects that have a default struct 
00049 // packing other than 2 (this is typically 4). On Macintosh
00050 // the default byte packing is 4, and it is with this packing
00051 // that all Max structs are packed on Macintosh. If for some 
00052 // reason you are using a struct byte packing of something other
00053 // than 4 on macintosh, there may be problems. Please let us
00054 // know, and we can address this and the other Max header files to 
00055 // ensure 4 byte struct packing on Macintosh in such a setting.
00056 #define C74_PRAGMA_STRUCT_PACKPUSH  0
00057 #define C74_PRAGMA_STRUCT_PACK      0
00058 #define C74_STRUCT_PACK_SIZE        4
00059 
00060 #endif // MAC_VERSION
00061 
00062 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00063 // Win32 Target
00064 
00065 #ifdef WIN_VERSION
00066 
00067 #if !defined( __cplusplus )
00068 #define FPTR_ELLIPSES       0
00069 #else
00070 #define FPTR_ELLIPSES       1
00071 #endif
00072 
00073 // the C74_PRAGMA_STRUCT_PACK* macros are used to ensure that 
00074 // Win32 builds of Max externals use a 2 byte struct packing 
00075 // for all Max structs in projects that have a default struct 
00076 // packing other than 2 (this is typically 4). On Macintosh
00077 // the default byte packing is 4, and it is with this packing
00078 // that all Max structs are packed on Macintosh. If for some 
00079 // reason you are using a struct byte packing of something other
00080 // than 4 on macintosh, there may be problems. Please let us
00081 // know, and we can address this and the other Max header files to 
00082 // ensure 4 byte struct packing on Macintosh in such a setting.
00083 #if ((defined(_MSC_VER) && !defined(__MWERKS__)) || (defined(__MWERKS__)&&(__MWERKS__ >= 0x0900)))
00084 // Visual C++ or Metrowerks >=0x0900 support pack(push,n)
00085 // this may not accomodate building for a windows target
00086 // using Metrowerks on a macintosh, which might need to use 
00087 // the pragma align statement.
00088 #define C74_PRAGMA_STRUCT_PACKPUSH  1
00089 #else
00090 #define C74_PRAGMA_STRUCT_PACKPUSH  0
00091 #endif
00092 #define C74_PRAGMA_STRUCT_PACK      1
00093 #define C74_STRUCT_PACK_SIZE        2
00094 
00095 #pragma warning( disable : 4005 ) // macro redefinition
00096 #pragma warning( disable : 4101 ) // unreferenced local
00097 #pragma warning( disable : 4800 ) // forcing value to bool 'true' or 'false'
00098 #pragma warning( disable : 4805 ) // unsafe mix of type 'BOOL' and type 'bool'
00099 #pragma warning( disable : 4087 ) // 'function' declared with 'void' parameter list
00100 #pragma warning( disable : 4068 ) // unknown pragma
00101 #pragma warning( disable : 4244 ) // implicit larger to smaller type conversion (int + float)
00102 #pragma warning( disable : 4245 ) // implicit unsigned/signed type conversion
00103 #pragma warning( disable : 4305 ) // truncation from 'type1' to 'type2' (e.g. double->float)
00104
